title: IP Infringement: Basics
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: IP Infringement: Basics.

hook.text: A company copies your product design exactly and sells it cheaper. That's infringementâ€”and you can sue.

buildup.text: IP infringement is unauthorized use of protected intellectual propertyâ€”using, copying, or selling without permission.

discovery.text: Each IP type has its own test: likelihood of confusion for trademarks, substantial similarity for copyrights.

twist.text: Infringement can be unintentional. You can violate a patent you never knew existed and still be liable.

climax.text: Remedies include injunctions, monetary damages, and sometimes the infringer's profits.

punchline.text: Using someone's IP without permission has a name: infringement.

quiz.question: Can you infringe a patent you didn't know about?
